title: Calories in Chicken Fry
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken fry per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Breaded, deep-fried chicken pieces with skin; standard fast-food style recipe, no extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, breading type, oil used, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of breaded fried chicken provides ~253 kcal and ~24 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chicken fry?
faqs.a: Approximately 253 kcal for breaded, deep-fried chicken fry.

faqs.q: Is chicken fry high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 24 g protein per 100 g, making it a good source.

faqs.q: What makes chicken fry high in fat?
faqs.a: Breading and frying in oil contribute ~14 g fat per 100 g.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in chicken fry?
faqs.a: Opt for air-frying, remove skin, or skip breading to cut 60-80 kcal per 100 g.
Yes, around 8.6 g per 100 g, mostly from the breading.
